topics.title: Lithos Protocol Overview and Core Features
topics.summary: Introduction to Lithos as a decentralized mining pool protocol using smart contracts. Covers key benefits including complete miner control over block production, smart contract-based payments, and collateralized mining pools that enable earning ERG through collateralization.

topics.title: Difficulty Parameter Control and Local Mining
topics.summary: Explanation of Lithos client as a locally run program that eliminates latency and stale shares. Introduces the difficulty parameter (D) as a key tool for miners to control reward consistency and ERG earnings per block, contrasting with traditional mining pool systems.

topics.title: Difficulty Adjustment Impact on Mining Rewards
topics.summary: Detailed analysis using examples showing how difficulty adjustments affect payment frequency and ERG amounts per payment. Demonstrates that while higher difficulty increases ERG per payment, it reduces payment stability, with long-term earnings balancing out proportionally to hash rate contribution.

topics.title: Mining Strategy Recommendations and Testing
topics.summary: Recommendations for miners on difficulty optimization, emphasizing that default values work for most users but encouraging testnet experimentation. Suggests factoring in Autolykos 2 table generation time for hardware-specific optimization to maximize profits.

topics.title: Lithos Testnet Features and Roadmap
topics.summary: Overview of upcoming testnet features including difficulty adjustment and automatic demurrage collection. Notes that MEV and transaction selection capabilities exist in the protocol but won't have UI support in the initial testnet release.
